intro: Sideroxylon saxorum var. collinum, commonly known as the Sierra Madre ironwood, is a shrub or small tree native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its dense, woody structure and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that are followed by orange to red berries. It is well adapted to dry climates and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Its hardy nature makes it a valuable species for ecological restoration in arid environments.
